item.title: Counseling Center Announces Drop-in Counseling Hours for Fall 2025
item.description: The RPI Counseling Center invites students to meet with a counselor without a formal appointment, during designated drop-in hours. There are two hours available for walk-in each day (M/F - 10 a.m. to 12 p.m.; T/W/Th - 2 to 4 p.m.). Drop-in counseling is available on a first come, first served basis on days when classes are in session. Students who cannot attend drop-in times can call (518) 276-6479 to schedule an appointment.
item.author: Students

item.title: Cognitive Science Undergraduate Information Session | Sept. 13
item.description: Are you considering a major or dual-major in Cognitive Science, Psychological Science, or Philosophy? Please join us on Wednesday, September 3 in Carnegie 113 at 12pm for FREE PIZZA! Learn about degree requirements, dual-major opportunities, the BS+MS co-term program, and hear about active research going on in the Cognitive Science department from faculty and graduate students. You will also learn about opportunities to get involved in research through the Undergraduate Research Program (URP).
item.author: Students

item.title: Student Insurance Plan Change for 2025 - 2026
item.description: The RPI student health insurance plan has renewed for the 2025-2026 year. There are no changes to the insurance benefits and there is no increase in the health insurance fee. However, there has been a change in the insurance carrier. The new carrier is Aetna. Students are encouraged to complete enrollment on the insurance portal to activate their health insurance benefits. The deadline to waive out of the plan is September 1st.
item.author: Students

item.title: Level Up with Lally Clubs | Sept. 4
item.description: Join us for Level Up Lally on September 4th from 5:00–6:00 PM in Lally Hall 104! Kick off the semester by connecting with RCC and Lally’s top clubs, including Women in Business, Finance Club, and the Business Honors Society. Meet upperclassmen and alumni, learn how to get involved in real-world projects, and discover the club that best aligns with your goals. Contact: saunde2@rpi.edu

item.title: Calling all new students! Join us for RPI Libraries’ Open House (pssst… there’s ice cream and raffle prizes!) | Sept. 3
item.description: Wednesday, Sept 3 from 2-3:30pm. Enjoy some ice cream and enter to win raffle prizes from local establishments. Complete your raffle entry card by visiting each library station to learn about our services, including the library’s service desk, discovery tool, individual and group study rooms, interlibrary loan, LibKey Nomad, the Architecture Library, Institute Archives, and the Student Success Center.

item.title: Annual State Fire Inspections in Residential Buildings Begin September 3
item.description: The New York State Office of Fire Prevention and Control (OFPC) conducts annual building inspections of all college and universities across the state. Inspections of RPI residential buildings will begin on September 3, 2025, and are expected to take approximately three to four weeks.

item.title: Fellowship info Session to Highlight Competitions for Grad School Salary and Tuition | Sept. 3
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Competitive fellowships provide salary and tuition for masters and PhD students. Seniors and graduate students will learn how to find and apply to appropriate programs that will fund fall 2026 and beyond. Programs are available for all stages of your academic career. International students are welcome! Register for the virtual session. Email madige@rpi.edu for information.

item.title: A Night of A Cappella | Sept. 3
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 8:00 PM - 10:00 PM - Get to know RPI’s 5 a cappella groups in our first performance of the semester! You will get to meet all of the members from each group, engage in some fun warm-up and ice breakers, as well as hear short performances from each group. We hope to see you there!

item.title: CMDIS Facilities Open House | Sept. 3
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM - Center for Materials, Devices and Integrated Systems (CMDIS) invites you to the Facilities Open House. Sign-up for facility tours to learn about new acquisitions, tools, instrumentation capabilities, fabrication and characterization techniques. Get information about educational programs and short courses. Meet with our technical team and discuss how we can help your research. The event will be followed by BBQ. Sign-up to tours by 08/29.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Friday, September 5
item.description: Date: Friday, September 5, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., will be reviewing the online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Please RSVP if you plan to attend and learn more about Rensselaer at Work.
item.author: Community

item.title: New Jersey | Amazon Fulfillment Center Tour | Oct. 22
item.description: Date: 10/22/2025 10:45 AM to 2:30 PM Ever wonder how Amazon gets your packages to you so quickly? Here is your chance to go on a behind-the-scenes tour at the Amazon Fulfillment Center in Edison, NJ. Mario Munoz ’07 will lead RPI alumni on a private guided tour and show you in real time how orders are fulfilled. Space is extremely limited, and you can bring only one guest (age 6 or over). We will have lunch nearby after the tour. Please register ASAP so you won’t miss out.

item.description: Members of DotCIO’s Enterprise Information Services team are pleased to announce upcoming changes to SIS (Student Information System) on Wednesday September 17. This upgrade brings a fresh look, improved navigation, and a more user-friendly experience. Please click in for a link to a short video providing a tour of the new landing page and where to find the tools you use most.

item.title: Faculty and Staff In-Person Workshop: Tips for Incorporating Digital Story Telling as Assignments | Sept. 8
item.description:
Date: Monday, September 8, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - In this workshop we will discuss a high overview of the meaning of digital story telling, advantages, story telling assignment practices, and review the Six-Word Story, Six Unique Shots assignment concept. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will be presenting this workshop. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.
